conversationHistory.botResponse:
Hello! I can certainly help you with storing leftover dal and reducing food waste.

• Allow the dal to cool completely before refrigerating. Store it in an airtight container in the refrigerator. This can extend its shelf life to 3-4 days.

• You can also freeze dal for longer storage. Divide it into portion-sized containers or freezer bags and freeze for up to 2-3 months.

• Consider making dal paratha with leftover dal. Mix the dal with wheat flour, spices, and a little oil to make a dough. Roll out the parathas and cook them on a griddle. This can cost approximately 25 BDT.

Reducing food waste can lower greenhouse gas emissions from landfills.

Next step: Try storing your dal in the refrigerator and use it within the next few days.

Hello! I can help with nutrition tips for vegetarians.

• Focus on protein and iron intake for a balanced diet.

• Include lentils (dal) which cost around 60 BDT per kg and spinach (palak) around 30 BDT per kg in your regular meals.

• These nutrients are essential for energy and overall health.

Next step: Try to include one lentil-based dish and one spinach dish in your weekly meal plan.
